meta.title: Soft Closure Update - Challis Joint School District #181

meta.content: April 27, 2020 Challis School District is following the State Board of Education’s soft closure through May 21, 2020. After listening to Governor Little’s plan outlining the stages of reopening the economy on Thursday, April 23, 2020 and clarifying discussions with District Health; it is evident that our schools could not meet criteria to fully return this calendar year. We will continue with online learning and once again express our sincere gratitude to parents/guardians and count…

link.title: Stanley Elementary - Jr. High School - News

p.img: We appreciate all your support and guidance to ensure your child's education continues!

span.p: Challis School District is following the State Board of Education’s soft closure through May 21, 2020. After listening to Governor Little’s plan outlining the stages of reopening the economy on Thursday, April 23, 2020 and clarifying discussions with District Health; it is evident that our schools could not meet criteria to fully return this calendar year.

We will continue with online learning and once again express our sincere gratitude to parents/guardians and countless others who have supported Challis School District staff to ensure student learning.

ol.li: During the soft closure attendance is taken daily.
Instruction will continue online through Teams and using packets.

ul.li: Kindergarten through 6th grade students will have lessons focused in Math, Reading, Writing, Phonics and English. Mrs. Lightburn, Mr. Gregory, Mrs. Hancock and Mrs. Smith have provided optional activities.
Students 7th grade through 12th grade will be responsible to complete assignments for each of their 7 daily courses.

span.p: Please remember to reach out to your child’s teacher if you need support or have concerns. They are more than willing to assist you and your child with assignments at home.
Graduation will be held on Sunday, May 17, 2020. The senior class advisors will be working with seniors to plan this unique graduation ceremony.
The feedback from staff, parents and community is appreciated and taken into consideration.
Remember to follow CDC guidelines on how to slow the spread of COVID-19.

At this time if you have questions or concerns about your child’s health contact your physician or the Challis Area Health Center. Further information is available on the CDC website https://www.cdc.gov or Eastern Idaho Public Health Hotline’s toll-free number 1(855) 533-3160.
